newsitem.title: CHINA: Beijing alarmed by surge in industrial accidents.
newsitem.headline: Beijing alarmed by surge in industrial accidents.

text.p: Beijing authorities, alarmed by a surge in the number of deaths from industrial accidents, convened an emergency meeting to try to curb such casualties, the Capital Economic Information Daily said on Saturday.
Forty workers were killed in industrial accidents in August, compared with 143 in the first seven months of 1996 or an average of 20.4 a month, the newspaper said. It gave no reason for the increase.
Beijing Vice-Mayor Jin Renqing convened an emergency meeting this month and decided that officials must adopt measures to curb the rise in the number of deaths from industrial accidents.
A total of 155 industrial accidents were reported in the Chinese capital in the first eight months, 68 of them at construction sites, it said.
Eighty-four building workers were killed, accounting for 45.9 percent of the total, the newspaper said.
A construction boom in Beijing has attracted thousands of out-of-town farmers to work as construction workers.
Separately, 62 miners were killed in 51 mining accidents in Beijing, the newspaper said.
